required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Medical Menstrual Regulation in the United States
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Acceptability and Use of Medical Menstrual Regulation in the United States

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the acceptability and use of medical menstrual regulation among women in the United States.

detailed_description.textblock: Medical menstrual regulation (MMR) entails the use of uterine evacuation medications by women with late menses without confirming pregnancy status. Provision of MMR in the United States could expand reproductive choice and service options for women. This study will collect data on the acceptability, efficacy, safety and feasibility of MMR among women with missed menses of 1-21 days

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who report that MMR was acceptable or highly acceptable during the exit interview
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after mifepristone administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants not pregnant at follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after mifepristone administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events and/or side effects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after mifepristone administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived advantages and disadvantages of MMR as reported by participants during the exit interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after mifepristone administration

arm_group.description: Mifepristone 200 mg orally on day 1. Misoprostol 800 mcg buccally on day 2 (24 hours after mifepristone).

intervention.description: All participants will receive 200 mg mifepristone, to be taken orally on day 1.
All participants will receive 800 mcg misoprostol, to be taken buccally 24 hours after mifepristone (day 2)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18-49 years
2. General good health
3. Does not want to be pregnant
4. Does not want to verify pregnancy status at the study site
5. History of regular monthly menstrual cycles
6. Missed menses of 1-21 days
7. Sexual activity in the past 2 months
8. Willing and able to sign consent forms
9. Willing to provide urine sample at enrollment
10. Willing to return for a follow-up visit
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known allergies or contraindications to mifepristone and/or misoprostol
2. Symptoms of or risk factors for ectopic pregnancy
3. Current use of an IUD, contraceptive implant or injectable

patient_data.ipd_description: Sharing de-identified data will be considered upon individual request.
